utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was unstoppable. I mean, I was, I was on fire. It was like my mind and my body were totally connected, like, like athletes must feel when they’re in the zone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Again, it was miniature golf.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Admit it, you’re a little turned on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You can’t be this proud.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because I beat you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good. You’re back.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We have some exciting news.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As you know, Amy and I have been together a long time, and a lot of things I never thought possible now seem possible.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: After a careful evaluation of our relationship, we decided that the time was right to take a step forward.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you want to say it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let’s say it together.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: We’re getting a turtle.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is why I’ve been saying we should keep champagne on ice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sarcasm?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. That was tricky, ’cause when it comes to alcohol, she generally means business.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we’re, we’re very happy for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you. Acquiring a joint pet is a big step for us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. It’s true. It means that we care so much about each other, there’s enough left over for an eight-ounce reptile.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why a turtle?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: After much deliberation, we’ve determined that a turtle is the ideal pet. They don’t shed fur, they don’t make noise.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For Halloween, we can dress him as a cobblestone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. And if he ever goes berserk, I know I can outrun him. Coincidentally, that’s also why I chose you as a roommate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, congratulations. Who would’ve thought you two would be the first in our group to start a family?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s what I said.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, where’s your roommate tonight?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well, I thought it was a little unfair that she’s always here, and you never get a chance to stay over, so I killed her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But remember our agreement? You can joke about murdering people, but you have to say just kidding.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: And the more important thing to remember is that I’d never hurt you. Oh, crap. I have to run over to the hospital and check on a patient.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s okay. I can come back later.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No. No, don’t be silly. I won’t be gone long. Just stay here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, cool. Oh, and you’re sure your roommate’s not gonna come back while I’m here alone, right? ‘Cause that’ll be awkward.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, don’t worry. She’s in Palm Springs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, good.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well, her torso is. Just kidding. I put her in a wood chipper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord. Oh, dear Lord.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s okay. You made it. We’re fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was a lot of puppies.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let’s forget about them, and pick ourselves out a nice turtle. Oh, how about this one up on the log?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. He kind of looks like a jerk. How about this one?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, he’s barely moving. He looks half dead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. I like him, too. Hi, little guy. How’d you like to come home with us? You’ll be living with me because we don’t live in the same house.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But that’s not your fault. Like you, we’re taking it ridiculously slow. You’ll stay with me when he’s at Comic-Con or away for work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or if they accept Daddy’s application to live on Mars.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, there’s this company that’s attempting to establish a colony on Mars, and I applied to be among the first to go. What should we name him? You know, I came in thinking Seth, but he kind of looks Italian.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You applied for a mission to be a colonist on another planet, and couldn’t be bothered to tell me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you have approved?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, based on your reaction, it looks like I made the right choice. Isn’t that right, Giuseppe?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Listen, I, I have a little confession to make.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, is this your first time?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I got you something for Valentine’s Day, and I was too embarrassed to give it to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, ’cause I got it at the dirty store.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You went to the dirty store without me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: In sunglasses and a hat after I parked two blocks away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, get it. Get it for me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, uh, well, I hope it’s fun. I mean, it, it comes with paints, and, and it’s kind of creative and artistic.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, did you go to the dirty store or Michaels?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no. We cover ourselves in body paint, and then, then we get on this big canvas and do our thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whoa, that’s kind of a big step for a guy who only recently agreed to take his socks off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re making fun of me. Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. No, come on, I want to do it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, let’s you, me, and your very, very pale feet make some art. Hey, when you got back to this store, I want to go with you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, but it’s a drive, the one I went to is in San Diego.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How are the taxes going?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. But you got a lot of receipts for the Lego store in here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Those are business expenses. You can write those off.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: A two hundred dollar R2-D2 is a business expense?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, Bernie, you’re gonna have to sound a lot more confident when we get audited. Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, Emily ran back to the hospital, so I’m just hanging out at her place. What are you, uh, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just playing video games while Bernie does the taxes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you, a little kid? Is she gonna cut your dinner into little pieces, too?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She doesn’t have to, I filled up on jelly beans.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, uh, what game are you… Oh. Crap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t get Emily’s night-stand to close.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s gonna know I was looking in it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why were you looking in it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, there’s a question I better have a good answer to before she gets back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, calm down. There’s probably something jammed behind it. Just, uh, pull it out and see what’s there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hang on. Oh no. Oh, no. Oh, God, no.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know what, you sound busy, I’m gonna let you go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, the whole front came off. Now she’s gonna know I was snooping.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s happening?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj was snooping through Emily’s drawers and broke one.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Aw. I’m gonna miss her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought it’d be a little more, just more.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not even sure why we were out of breath. Uh, I mean, did we move at all?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe along the z-axis, but x and y are looking pretty sad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, come on. We are not old boring people. We can do better than this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, Th, that’s true. How late did we stay up last night?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Almost 1am.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Damn straight, almost 1am. And we weren’t even watching TV. We were watching Netflix, like the kids do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, is it a comedy? Is it a drama? Nobody knows. Now, come on. We are gonna do this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. You get the paint, I’ll rest for 30 to 40 minutes, and then we do this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t believe you almost had me bring a wild animal into my home.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No one told you to poke the turtle’s face.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was playing Got Your Nose. That’s how you get children to like you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m surprised you even care if he likes you, since you’re planning on leaving the planet the first chance you get.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ugh, this again. Amy, I’ve already had one new hole torn in my body today. I don’t need another one.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I know the odds of you even going to Mars are incredibly small, but it still hurts that you would volunteer for something that would take you away from me forever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So you’re saying you wouldn’t leave me for the chance to be one of the first humans to colonize another planet?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I would at least mention it before filling out the application.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Huh, that’s exactly what Leonard, Wolowitz, Koothrappali, Bernadette and Penny said.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And who says you could even survive an interplanetary mission, anyway? You could barely survive a tiny turtle bite.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: First of all, this has only made me stronger. But beyond that, all I did was fill out an application.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know what? Go to Mars, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is there anything I can do to cheer you up?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if I play the Star Trek theme on my nose?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Please don’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yep, you’re mad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, let me see the damage.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hang on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I think you broke the dowels. You’re not gonna have time to glue it back on, you’ll have to nail it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: With what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Does she have any pillows or wine glasses?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She does.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Neither of those. Try a hammer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did that feel good? You feel like a big man now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was going to make you red zinger, but since Mars is the red planet, I went with peppermint.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why do you even want to do this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, as part of the application, I was required to make a short video answering that very question. You want to see it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can’t you just tell me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I made a video.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on video)
utterance.content: I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and I’d like to tell you why I should be chosen to go to Mars. I’m exceedingly smart. I graduated college at 14. While my brother was getting an STD I was getting a PhD. Penicillin can’t take this away. Being in close quarters, cleanliness is important and my hygiene is impeccable. In fact, animals don’t trust me because I smell like nothing. Literally nothing. During the seven-month space flight, I can keep up morale with my wacky sense of humour. Hey, Leonard, is there any peanut brittle left in that can?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (on video)
utterance.content: You mean this weirdly suspicious one?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on video)
utterance.content: Yes. Open it and check.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (on video)
utterance.content: I don’t get it. There’s actually peanut brittle in… Please go to Mars.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on video)
utterance.content: But on a more serious note, the most important reason I want to go to Mars is that I believe, as a scientist, it’s my duty to push the boundaries of human knowledge forward. Now, I know that life on Mars will be difficult. But life here on Earth is no picnic. Also, picnics are no picnic. Where should we go for lunch? Oh, I know, the ground. In conclusion, thank you for considering me for this journey of a lifetime. To Mars.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Afterwards, Leonard blew his nose, and pie came out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right there, right there, Oh, God, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How did you get paint in your eye?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because you wouldn’t let me wear safety goggles.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This looks terrible. She, she’s gonna know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s fine. You just need two more nails.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, where should I put them?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: In Emily’s eyes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re not helping.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, maybe this is what you get for snooping.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, it, it’s bad enough that I have to deal with this…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Raj? I’m back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, no. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How was the hospital?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Fine. What were you doing in there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh w, well, okay, look, I, I don’t want to lie to you. I got curious, I was looking around and I broke the drawer on your night stand.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You were looking in my night stand?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: So, the first time I leave you alone, you snoop on me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’ve never snooped around my apartment?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, think back. It would really help if you had.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I can’t believe you don’t trust me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: She sounds really mad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should hang up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, we should.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But we’re not going to, are we?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What happened to snooping is wrong?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, you’re going to jail for tax fraud. Who cares?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we did it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We sure did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I mean, I was on fire. I, I was in the zone, like an athlete.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, I beat you at this, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, where do we want to hang it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Are you kidding? We’re not hanging it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But it’s an expression of our love.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And our butts. Not hanging it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seems a shame to throw it away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. We could give it to Sheldon, and tell him William Shatner painted it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: God, I love you. I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think I’m gonna go home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why? I really don’t understand what’s happening here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, Sheldon, at any other time, learning that you had plans to go live on Mars would be a slow news day. But a couple of hours ago, we were getting a turtle. And silly as it sounds, I thought that meant something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy. Oh, why didn’t I give her Sleepy Time tea? Amy, wait. Getting a turtle meant a great deal to me, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure. Unless something better comes along.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you want me to withdraw my application?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What I want is for us to be planning our future together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And in that future, are we on the same planet? Because I’ve seen people make the long-distance thing work.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’re on the same planet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Does that planet have to be Earth?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you asking me to go to Mars with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am. Yeah, if I’m going to a barren, lifeless environment where the chances of survival are slim to none, I want you there with me. Why don’t we go back to the apartment, and fill out your application?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. I suppose being the first people on a new planet would be incredibly exciting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I know. We could be the first to plant a flag on Mars. We could be the first to watch Mars Attacks! on Mars. We could be the first to say good lord, what on Mars are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, we could also be the first people to procreate on Mars.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You just can’t keep it in your space pants, can you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Think about it. If we had a family there, our kids would be Martians.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They would, wouldn’t they? We could give them cool Martian names. And we could teach them about Martian history. Like, who planted those flags? And, uh, where did that copy of Mars Attacks! come from?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess we’ll have to make a new video together, as a couple.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good idea. And since you’ve had such a rough day, I’m gonna let you throw the pie in Leonard’s face.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you for forgiving me.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: That’s okay. At some point, we were bound to have our first fight.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, it almost happened when you called my apple pie crust doughy, but the truth is you were right, and I was just angry at myself.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Can I ask you one thing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course. What?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Did you look in my closet?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. Just the drawer.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You promise you didn’t look in the closet?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I promise. Why, what’s in there?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it. Good night.
